intro: Comarostaphylis sleumeri, commonly known as the slender false heather, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and evergreen leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are usually white or pale pink, and they bloom during the warmer months of the year.
